pros:
Employees enjoy a family friendly, flexible work environment. Camaraderie is also good across departments and academic divisions. Generally Faculty and Staff employees are valued equally. Faculty and administrators recognize and value the work of the administrative, student success and campus service employees.

As a community college, Faculty do not have a "publish or perish" mandate so they actually get to enjoy their summers and downtime from classroom duties to work on their passions, update or refresh their curriculum, etc.

Benefits are amazing - insurance, 401K, Pension, access to college-sponsored sports/theater/music/activity center/pool, free tuition for spouse and family members to age 26, etc.
cons:
The pay is low, even compared to other public higher ed institutions in our state.  The college is working to bring full-time staff and faculty up to 85% of median through a compensation study and some set aside funds.

Bottom line, though, you work for Snow because of quality of life, easy 10-minute walking commute, access to public recreation and public lands, and rural lifestyle.  If you want more money and the 2 hour round-trip commute, go to SLC area.

review_title: Great place to work depending on who you work for
job_title: Anti-tobacco Grant Coordinator in Ephraim, UT
pros:
As a student working in the Wellness Center:
-flexible hours
-you get to work with lots of different people
-lots of opportunities to build resume
-great place to get experience in the therapy/social work setting
-lots of opportunities for leadership positions 
-pay is average
-they usually have 2-3 retreats for the students/volunteers/employees each school year for training. This is usually held in Southern Utah.
cons:
-They recently moved the Wellness Center from a more social environment to a secluded building. It's good for those who want more privacy when going to the campus therapist but it's not so great for the groups that the Wellness Center runs. There was more of an opportunity to network with the Student Body Officers.
-The office is small
-Again, the location is difficult. It's on one side of campus, so if you live on the other side...it's a walk.
